org.kurento.jsonrpc.client

Class JsonRpcClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kurento.jsonrpc.client.JsonRpcClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, JsonRpcRequestSender
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonRpcClientHttp, JsonRpcClientLocal, JsonRpcClientWebSocket

    public abstract class JsonRpcClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements JsonRpcRequestSender, java.io.Closeable
    This class is used to make request to a server using the JSON-RPC protocol with server events. This protocol can be implemented with two transport types: Websockets or http (for request-response) and long-pooling for server events. Request: The request is a JSON with the following fields:
    • method: Name of the operation to be executed in the server
    • params: Parameters of the operation
    • id: Used if the operation must return a response. This id is used to identify the response if it cannot be identified by means of underlying transport.
    Response: The response is a JSON with the following fields:
    • result: Result of the operation.
    • error: This field is used if operation generates an error.
    • id: request id

      • getConnectionTimeoutValue

        public int getConnectionTimeoutValue()
        Gets the connection timeout, in milliseconds, configured in the client.
        Returns:
        the timeout in milliseconds

      • setConnectionTimeoutValue

        public void setConnectionTimeoutValue(int connectionTimeout)
        Sets a connection timeout in milliseconds in the client. If after this timeout, the client could not connect with the server, the JsonRpcWSConnectionListener.connectionFailed() method will be invoked, and a KurentoException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        connectionTimeout - the timeout in milliseconds

      • getIdleTimeout

        public int getIdleTimeout()
        Gets the idle timeout (i.e. the time after which the session is considered as idle if no messages have been exchanged), in milliseconds, configured in the client.
        Returns:
        the timeout in milliseconds

      • setIdleTimeout

        public void setIdleTimeout(int idleTimeout)
        Sets an idle timeout in milliseconds in the client. If after the configured time, no messages have been exchanged between client and server, connection is reestablished automatically
        Parameters:
        idleTimeout - the timeout in milliseconds

      • getHeartbeatInterval

        public int getHeartbeatInterval()
        Gets the configured heartbeat interval in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the interval

      • setHeartbeatInterval

        Parameters:

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this client. Once a client has been closed, it is not available for further networking use (i.e. can't be reconnected or rebound). A new client needs to be created.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when closing this client.
        See Also:
        isClosed()
